questions.question: You should ............................. down on your sugar intake if you want to be healthy.
questions.description: To cut down on something is to reduce it.

questions.question: It is a good offer so don't turn it ................................
questions.description: To turn something down is to decline it.

questions.question: He slowed ................................ the car as if he was about to stop.
questions.description: To slow down is to reduce speed.

questions.question: I don't like people who talk .............................. to me.
questions.description: To talk down to somebody is to talk to someone as if you were their boss.

questions.question: She refuses to dress .......................... even when she is on a holiday.
questions.description: To dress down is to wear simple clothes.

questions.question: The police must crack ........................... on smugglers.
questions.description: To crack down on criminals is to be strict with criminals.

questions.question: None of them showed .............................. at the party.
questions.description: To show up is to arrive.

questions.question: The battery blew ............................... while I was charging it.
questions.description: To blow up is to explode.

questions.question: Slow down! I can't keep .............................. with you.
questions.description: To keep up with somebody is to continue at the same rate as them.

questions.question: The doctor advised him to give ............................... smoking.
questions.description: To give up smoking is to quit smoking.

questions.question: I ended .............................. paying a lot more than I expected to.
questions.description: To end up doing something is to do it eventually.

questions.question: Women make .............................. 60 percent of the total staff.
questions.description: Make up can mean comprise or compose.
